meta.label: Write data partitions to multiple sheets in an Excel file
meta.description: This recipe partitions data and writes data partitions to multiple sheets in an Excel file in a managed folder. Note: the name of a new file should be unique, otherwise, the new file will overwrite the existing file if the new and existing files have the same name.

inputRoles.name: input_dataset
inputRoles.label: Input dataset
inputRoles.description: This is the input dataset that will be partitioned.

outputRoles.name: output_folder
outputRoles.label: Output Folder
outputRoles.description: This is the folder where the data partitions will saved.

params.name: partitioning_column
params.label: Partitioning column(s)
params.description: Enter the column or columns in the input dataset whose unique values will be used to filter the data partitions. Separate several columns with commas. If this field is empty, the whole data will be written to a sheet of an excel file the folder. If partitioning column is entered, you will be see an option to use unique values of partitioning column as Excel sheet names

params.name: use_partition_value_for_sheetname
params.label: Use unique values of partitioning column as Excel sheet names.
params.description: Check this button to use unique values of partitioning column as EXCEL sheet names. The default names - Sheet1, Sheet2, etc - will be used for sheet names if this field is left empty.

params.name: sheet_name
params.label: Sheet Name [Optional]. Use if no partitioning column is specified
params.description: Enter sheet name. The default name, Sheet1, will be used if this field is left empty.

params.name: columns_to_exclude
params.label: Column(s) to exclude
params.description: These is(are) the column(s) to exclude from the data partitions written to the folder.

params.name: use_existing_file
params.label: Write to an existing Excel file in the folder
params.description: Check this button to write to an existing Excel file in the folder. Existing sheets will be preserved and new sheets will be added to the existing file.

params.name: existing_file
params.label: Existing File Name [Required]
params.description: Enter the existing file name as it appears in the folder without including the .xlsx extension.

params.name: file_name
params.label: New Excel File Name [Optional]
params.description: Enter a unique and new Excel file name. If this name already exists in the folder, the existing file will be overwritten. The dataset name will be used if this field is left empty.

params.name: start_col
params.label: Start column [Optional]
params.description: This is the upper left cell column to dump data. The default value is 0, and will be used if this field is left empty.

params.name: start_row
params.label: Start row [Optional]
params.description: This is the upper left cell row to dump data. The default value is 0, and will be used if this field is left empty.

params.name: include_timestamp
params.label: Include timestamp to EXCEL file names
params.description: Check this button to include timestamps to EXCEL file names.

params.name: clear_folder
params.label: Clear folder
params.description: WARNING! Existing files in this folder will be deleted if Check this button to clear the folder before writing new EXCEL files.
